intro: Bassia copleyi, commonly known as sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Bassia copleyi is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
